entry.title: Arrests, intimidation of opposition candidates ahead of Gyumri election

media:group.media:title: Arrests, intimidation of opposition candidates ahead of Gyumri election
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan escalates his long-standing feud with the country‚Äôs three former presidents with another live debate challenge. üìç Opposition alliances sound the alarm in Gyumri following office raids and arrests of members ahead of a tight municipal election this weekend. üìç CivilNet spoke to border residents who have recently been hearing shots from Azerbaijani side. They say they feel safer with the EU monitors there, a group Baku demands be removed. üìç Turkish and Armenian consuls in Aleppo, Syria meet in a rare diplomatic exchange between the two nations.

entry.title: Turning the tables on Baku‚Äôs information warfare

media:group.media:title: Turning the tables on Baku‚Äôs information warfare
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, Eric Hacopian focuses on the issue of disinformation by Baku and the need for Armenians to be more critical before spreading such news. He gives recent examples of how Azerbaijan tries to control the narrative by purchasing articles in legitimate-sounding outlets and names one of the questionable characters who assists the process. He encourages Armenians to adopt a skeptical lens for all news coming from their country‚Äôs enemies, and to go on the media offensive instead of merely reacting to dubious stories.

entry.title: Bridging Armenia and Georgia through stories #shorts

media:group.media:title: Bridging Armenia and Georgia through stories #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Though neighbors, Armenians and Georgians know little about each other. A special night at the Woods Center in Yerevan, hosted by the PEN Centers of Armenia and Georgia, brought authors and artists together for a cultural dialogue. Featuring the new translation of Georgian writer Tamta Melashvili‚Äôs novel Counting Out into Armenia and the electrifying ‚Äú7 Voices, 7 Sounds‚Äù concert, the event highlighted the power of literature and music to connect beyond borders.

entry.title: Armenia in the Meat Grinder of Geopolitics: Alexander Iskandaryan

media:group.media:title: Armenia in the Meat Grinder of Geopolitics: Alexander Iskandaryan
media:group.media:description:
In his talk titled ‚ÄúArmenia in the Meat Grinder of Geopolitics,‚Äù political scientist Alexander Iskandaryan discusses the recent dramatic changes to Armenia's foreign policy which have occurred due to external circumstances, while the structure of its domestic has remained unchanged. Iskandaryan delivered the talk at the conference "Gathering Storm: Regional Security in the South Caucasus Amid the Global Order Crisis," organized by the Caucasus Institute in Yerevan on March 21, 2025.

entry.title: EU integration bill passes in Armenian parliament

media:group.media:title: EU integration bill passes in Armenian parliament
media:group.media:description:
üìç The Armenian parliament passed a bill in its second and final reading, declaring the country‚Äôs aspiration to join the European Union. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry acknowledged that gunfire is occasionally heard along the border with Azerbaijan but maintains that it ‚Äúdoes not target Armenian territory.‚Äù This marks the first official recognition of the tense situation at the frontier after almost two weeks of Azerbaijani reports alleging ceasefire violations by Armenia. üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio held a phone conversation to discuss the U.S.-Armenia strategic partnership and regional issues.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Western Pivot: Smart Move or a Risky Gamble?

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Western Pivot: Smart Move or a Risky Gamble?
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Pavel Baev, a professor at the Peace Research Institute in Oslo, is in Yerevan to participate in a conference organized by the Caucasus Institute. The program is entitled ‚ÄúGathering Storm: Regional Security of the South Caucasus in the Context of the Crisis of the Global Order.‚Äù Dr. Baev speaks with CivilNet about Russia‚Äôs foreign policy and whether the current geopolitical shifts may see Moscow make a stronger comeback in the South Caucasus. He also assesses Armenia‚Äôs western pivot at this moment when the global liberal order appears to be ending under President Donald Trump.
0:00 Introduction 0:47 How is the changing world order affecting Russia's foreign policy? 5:35 Have Russia's strategic goals in the South Caucasus changed in recent years? 9:13 Did Russia see the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh War coming or even facilitate it? 10:02 What does Russia make of the ascendent Turkey-Azerbaijan power in the South Caucasus? 13:06 Is Armenia's pivot to Europe wise amid the rise of US-Russia cooperation? 16:13 What is Russia's future in the South Caucasus?
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #SecureRegion

entry.title: Pre-Soviet Yerevan through the lens of Gegham Tarverdyants #shorts

media:group.media:title: Pre-Soviet Yerevan through the lens of Gegham Tarverdyants #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Gegham Tarverdyants was one of Yerevan‚Äôs earliest photographers, capturing numerous images of what is now the Armenian capital in the early 1900s. CivilNet revisited some of the locations he photographed to show how much the city has changed over time.
